chrom.description: A string specifying a chromosome of region to be plotted

chromstart.description: An integer start position on chromosome to be plotted

chromend.description: An integer end position on chromosome to be plotted

assembly.description: A string representing the default genome assembly or a\link[plotgardener]{assembly} object

fill.description: A character value, a vector, or a\link[plotgardener]{colorby} object specifying fill colors of range elements

linecolor.description: A character value, a vector, or a\link[plotgardener]{colorby} object specifying the color of the linesoutlining range elements

order.description: A character value specifying how to order pileup databefore assigning rows

collapse.description: A logical value indicating whether to collapserange elements into a single row, or intotwo rows if \code{strandSplit = TRUE}

boxHeight.description: A numeric or unit object specifying height of range elementboxes

spaceWidth.description: A numeric value specifying the width of minimum spacingbetween range element boxes, as a fraction of the plot's genomic range

spaceHeight.description: A numeric value specifying the height of spacing betweenrange element boxes on different rows, as a fraction of boxHeight

limitLabel.description: A logical value indicating whether to draw a "+"when not all elements can be plotted in the plotting space

strandSplit.description: A logical value indicating whether plus andminus-stranded elements should be separated

bg.description: A character value indicating background color

baseline.description: A logical value indicating whether to include abaseline along the x-axis

x.description: A numeric or unit object specifying ranges plot x-location

y.description: A numeric, unit object, or character containing a "b"combined with a numeric value specifying ranges plot y-location

width.description: A numeric or unit object specifying ranges plot width

height.description: A numeric or unit object specifying ranges plot height

just.description: A string specifying the justification of ranges plot relative to its (x, y) location

default.units.description: A string indicating the default units to useif \code{x}, \code{y}, \code{width}, or \code{height} are only givenas numerics

draw.description: A logical value indicating whether graphics output shouldbe produced

params.description: An optional \link[plotgardener]{pgParams} objectcontaining relevant function parameters
